document_title: Pneumoconiosis (dust in the lungs): Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Professor Wu Guizhou said that symptoms vary depending on the causative agent and severity of the disease. Patients may have no symptoms, or have symptoms ranging from mild to severe. The most common symptoms are:
Dry cough or cough with black phlegm;; May cough up blood in the morning;; Feeling of sharp pain in the chest, chest tightness;; Difficulty breathing, shortness of breath.
Patients may cough dryly, cough up black phlegm or cough up blood
subsection_data:
bui phoi.json. Common symptoms
Professor Wu Guizhou said that symptoms vary depending on the causative agent and severity of the disease. Patients may have no symptoms, or have symptoms ranging from mild to severe. The most common symptoms are:
